This game definitely deserves to be one of my favourite games ever. The gameplay is so much better than the original Portal, the soundtrack is SO GOOD, the co-op offered me much fun, and the gel mechanics are fantastic. Plus, with mods like Portal Stories: Mel and Aperture tag, the fun is endless. One of the best games of all time, please consider playing it. Stay safe!

This game has some great narrative and a good and funny story, with some good twists. I would for sure recommend this to fans of the Portal series, and some references to Half-Life.

First off I hate puzzles and usually have no tolerance for them. This game held my interest until i was about 80 percent through. The story just wasn't very good, and the humor got a little repetitive although it still made me chuckle here and there.  The characters and setting was just very shallow and not really explained that well it seems like the plot was concocted to have an excuse for you to solve puzzles. The half life games had the illusion of freedom even though the game is very linear. There is no illusion in portal 2 as you are very much on rails the entire time, the game is at its best when they take the wheels off and you escape the lab  in chapter 6 which was one of the highlights and breaks up the monotony which could be a bit tedious during long playthroughs. They do keep the game interesting by adding new gameplay challenges although the slow pacing started to wear me down towards the end. It wasn't really an addicting game for me and i got kind of tired after about a week of playing and cheated a little to look up some of the puzzles at the end. They weren't unsolvable but they are definitely above average difficulty in my opinion and will take you much longer to finish on your own. I'm dumb and impatient so this game wasn't my cup of tea however i can respect its excellence in craft and level design.  One of the best soundtrack in a game period. Overall 7/10 for the solo campaign. I did not try co-op but i feel you can up the rating to 8 as it looks pretty fun and quite unique.

Love this game so much! First played it in 2016 and have been replaying it since. Everything is amazing and if I was forced to I'd play this game for the rest of eternity. :)

Fascinated how this game still holds up even after 9 years of its release. I was like 6 when it came out so ai didn't have the chance to play it, but after I got my hands on it, boy it is such a blast. This game looks, feels and plays fantastically even in 2020 standerds so I can't imagine how much of a thrill this was in 2011. Obviously there are a couple of bugs and there is the co op trading feature that still notes "coming soon" and the fact that it gives me motion sickness and nausea, but that didn't stop me from enjoying the game. The thing that I am surprised by the most is how active the playerbase is and how fast you can find a co op partner. I can't a third official installment from valve, at least any time soon but this is a, hands down, GREAT game.

Great game. The start is a little slow, but overall pacing is incredible. It has the best ending half an hour out of any game I have played. Incredible, and going into blind without any guides is the way you should play. I have started the co-op with a friend of mine, and we are having a lot of fun with that too. 10/10, incredible.

Alright, you absolutely need to play this game. Perhaps being the highest rated game on steam will convince you.

Portal is one of the best games ever made. It's gameplay is simple, yet offers room for complex puzzles. The story is great and the characters are well written. The years of mods offer endless replayability. Not overpriced either. What started as a simple concept has grown into a storied part of gaming culture. Portal showed me what a great game could be. So go get it right now.
